title: HW 13 Solutions
content: <document version="2.0"><file url="https://static.us.edusercontent.com/files/YE6n15p5W36rA2Z9adtoEd6r" filename="hw13_question.pdf"/><paragraph>This has been corrected in response to a student reported typo! Thank you!</paragraph><file url="https://static.us.edusercontent.com/files/b7BiGedEgEuhNQiaVc1mT3yM" filename="hw13_solution.pdf"/></document>
document: This has been corrected in response to a student reported typo! Thank you!

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>Could you also post the solutions for HW12?</paragraph></document>
comments.document: Could you also post the solutions for HW12?

comments.content: are these typos? The infinity should be negative and the < 0 should be > 0 right?
comments.document: are these typos? The infinity should be negative and the < 0 should be > 0 right?

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>You are correct. Thank you for pointing out these typos. We have fixed them now. Indeed it is important that when the model is correct, the gap in implicit rewards goes to negative infinity and the sigmoid of that is zero, allowing those examples to be ignored.<break/><break/>And when the model is incorrect, the gap is greater than zero, making the model pay attention to these mistakes during its training by having a larger gradient. </paragraph><paragraph/></document>
comments.document:
You are correct. Thank you for pointing out these typos. We have fixed them now. Indeed it is important that when the model is correct, the gap in implicit rewards goes to negative infinity and the sigmoid of that is zero, allowing those examples to be ignored.

And when the model is incorrect, the gap is greater than zero, making the model pay attention to these mistakes during its training by having a larger gradient.

comments.content: It seems there may be several typos in the solution to Q4, part (b)? I think the above equation should contain 1/1 - αt-1 instead of 1/1 - αt, and 2sqrt(αt-1)/1- αt-1 instead of 2sqrt(αt)/1- αt. Similarly, the answer below should be (1- αt-1)sqrt(1-βt) on the numerator instead of (1- αt)sqrt(1-βt).
comments.document: It seems there may be several typos in the solution to Q4, part (b)? I think the above equation should contain 1/1 - αt-1 instead of 1/1 - αt, and 2sqrt(αt-1)/1- αt-1 instead of 2sqrt(αt)/1- αt. Similarly, the answer below should be (1- αt-1)sqrt(1-βt) on the numerator instead of (1- αt)sqrt(1-βt).

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>Correct. Good catches. Let me fix this. </paragraph></document>
comments.document: Correct. Good catches. Let me fix this.

comments.content: Is this a typo? Shouldn't the winner term come before the loser term? I believe the final answer is correct, but I just noticed this when trying to follow the algebra in the solutions.
comments.document: Is this a typo? Shouldn't the winner term come before the loser term? I believe the final answer is correct, but I just noticed this when trying to follow the algebra in the solutions.

comments.content: <document version="1.0"><paragraph>You are correct. Thank you for pointing this out! If the algebra were to follow according to this set up, we'd actually arrive at the "inverted" gradient (i.e., we want dispreferred answers instead of preferred answers). Furthermore, the way $u$ is defined in the problem should have the winner term first. <break/></paragraph></document>
comments.document: You are correct. Thank you for pointing this out! If the algebra were to follow according to this set up, we'd actually arrive at the "inverted" gradient (i.e., we want dispreferred answers instead of preferred answers). Furthermore, the way $u$ is defined in the problem should have the winner term first.

comments.content: <document version="1.0"><paragraph>Yup, that makes sense! Thank you!</paragraph></document>
comments.document: Yup, that makes sense! Thank you!
